cards.name: Sigarda's Aid
cards.text:
You may cast Aura and Equipment spells as though they had flash.
Whenever an Equipment enters the battlefield under your control, you may attach it to target creature you control.
cards.flavor: The Order of Saint Traft found new strength with Sigarda's support.
cards.originalText:
You may cast Aura and Equipment spells as though they had flash.
Whenever an Equipment enters the battlefield under your control, you may attach it to target creature you control.

cards.name: Sigardian Priest
cards.text: {1}, {T}: Tap target non-Human creature.
cards.flavor: Many whose faith was destroyed by Avacyn turned to the only angel who remained true to humanity.

rulings.text: A creature that is Human and has other types, such as a Human Werewolf, isn't a non-Human creature.

cards.originalText: {1}, {T}: Tap target non-Human creature.

cards.name: Spectral Reserves
cards.text: Create two 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying. You gain 2 life.
cards.flavor:
"My predecessors taught me of duty and commitment. It seems they have more to teach."
—Wendin, veteran cathar
cards.originalText: Put two 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying onto the battlefield. You gain 2 life.

cards.name: Steadfast Cathar
cards.text: Whenever Steadfast Cathar attacks, it gets +0/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The most resolute soldiers will press forward in the face of overwhelming odds."
—Gideon Jura
cards.originalText: Whenever Steadfast Cathar attacks, it gets +0/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Subjugator Angel
cards.text:
Flying
When Subjugator Angel enters the battlefield, tap all creatures your opponents control.
cards.flavor: The remnants of Innistrad's corrupted angelic hosts collapsed to form the Flight of Nightmares.
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Subjugator Angel enters the battlefield, tap all creatures your opponents control.

cards.name: Thalia, Heretic Cathar
cards.text:
First strike
Creatures and nonbasic lands your opponents control enter the battlefield tapped.
cards.flavor: "Salvation will not be granted by the Lunarch Council. It must be earned—at the edge of a sword, if necessary."

rulings.text: If an effect states that a creature or land enters the battlefield tapped unless a condition is met, Thalia's last ability has it enter tapped even if that condition is true. For example, your opponent may reveal a Plains while playing Port Town (from the Shadows over Innistrad set), but Port Town will still enter tapped.
If Thalia enters the battlefield at the same time as an opponent's creatures or nonbasic lands, those creatures and lands aren't affected by Thalia's last ability.

cards.originalText:
First strike
Creatures and nonbasic lands your opponents control enter the battlefield tapped.

cards.name: Thalia's Lancers
cards.text:
First strike
When Thalia's Lancers enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a legendary card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: "Let the points of our lances lead the way."
cards.originalText:
First strike
When Thalia's Lancers enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a legendary card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Thraben Standard Bearer
cards.text: {1}{W}, {T}, Discard a card: Create a 1/1 white Human Soldier creature token.
cards.flavor: The uncorrupted rallied under Thalia's leadership and Sigarda's banner.
cards.originalText: {1}{W}, {T}, Discard a card: Put a 1/1 white Human Soldier creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Advanced Stitchwing
cards.text:
Flying
{2}{U}, Discard two cards: Return Advanced Stitchwing from your graveyard to the battlefield tapped.
cards.flavor:
"Improvement is a consequence of practice."
—Stitcher Geralf

rulings.text: Advanced Stitchwing's last ability can only be activated while it's in your graveyard.

cards.originalText:
Flying
{2}{U}, Discard two cards: Return Advanced Stitchwing from your graveyard to the battlefield tapped.

cards.name: Chilling Grasp
cards.text:
Tap up to two target creatures. Those creatures don't untap during their controller's next untap step.
Madness {3}{U} (If you discard this card, discard it into exile. When you do, cast it for its madness cost or put it into your graveyard.)
cards.originalText:
Tap up to two target creatures. Those creatures don't untap during their controller's next untap step.
Madness {3}{U} (If you discard this card, discard it into exile. When you do, cast it for its madness cost or put it into your graveyard.)

cards.name: Coax from the Blind Eternities
cards.text: You may choose an Eldrazi card you own from outside the game or in exile, reveal that card, and put it into your hand.
cards.flavor: At Nahiri's call, Emrakul traversed the vast emptiness between the planes and arrived on Innistrad.

rulings.text: In a casual game, a card you choose from outside the game comes from your personal collection. In a tournament event, a card you choose from outside the game must come from your sideboard.
A card that is exiled face down has no characteristics. You can't choose it, even if you're allowed to look at it.
An Eldrazi card is one with the subtype Eldrazi. Noncreature cards with devoid from the Battle for Zendikar block are Eldrazi-themed, but they are not Eldrazi cards.

cards.originalText: You may choose an Eldrazi card you own from outside the game or in exile, reveal that card, and put it into your hand.

cards.name: Contingency Plan
cards.text: Look at the top five cards of your library. Put any number of them into your graveyard and the rest back on top of your library in any order.
cards.flavor:
"Improvisation is for those who failed to prepare."
—Jace Beleren
cards.originalText: Look at the top five cards of your library. Put any number of them into your graveyard and the rest back on top of your library in any order.

cards.name: Convolute
cards.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {4}.
cards.flavor:
"There's no sense arguing with insanity."
—Levana, Midnight Duelist
cards.originalText: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {4}.

cards.name: Curious Homunculus
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}. Spend this mana only to cast an instant or sorcery spell.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if there are three or more instant and/or sorcery cards in your graveyard, transform Curious Homunculus.

rulings.text: If you don't have enough instant and/or sorcery cards in your graveyard as your upkeep begins, Curious Homunculus's last ability doesn't trigger. If you don't have enough as the ability resolves, the ability has no effect.

Mana from Curious Homunculus's first ability can be spent to cast a spell that has generic mana in its additional cost, such as Borrowed Malevolence with both modes chosen. It can't be spent to pay costs during a spell's resolution, such as the cost Convolute prompts a player to pay.

If you activate Curious Homunculus's mana ability in response to its triggered ability, you can spend that mana to cast an instant spell during your upkeep after it has transformed into Voracious Reader. If you don't spend the mana, it will leave your mana pool before your draw step begins; you can't use it to cast the card you draw or to cast a sorcery.
For more information on double-faced cards, see the Shadows over Innistrad mechanics article (http://magic.wizards.com/en/articles/archive/feature/shadows-over-innistrad-mechanics).

foreignNames.name: 詮索好きのホムンクルス

cards.originalText:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast an instant or sorcery spell.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if there are three or more instant and/or sorcery cards in your graveyard, transform Curious Homunculus.

cards.name: Voracious Reader
cards.text:
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
Instant and sorcery spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
cards.flavor: Good books make you savor each word.

rulings.text: Abilities that reduce the cost of a spell apply after abilities that raise them. For example, Borrowed Malevolence with both modes chosen costs {1}{B} to cast if you control Voracious Reader.

If an instant or sorcery spell has {X} in its mana cost, choose the value for X first, and then reduce the cost by {1}. For example, Dark Salvation with X chosen as 2 costs {3}{B} to cast if you control Voracious Reader.

cards.originalText:
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
Instant and sorcery spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.

cards.name: Displace
cards.text: Exile up to two target creatures you control, then return those cards to the battlefield under their owner's control.
cards.flavor: "I'll see you soon, Subjects 25 and 26. I've got a good feeling this time!"

rulings.text: If a creature token is exiled this way, it will cease to exist and will not return to the battlefield.

After each creature returns to the battlefield, it will be a new object with no connection to the creature that was exiled. It won't be in combat or have any additional abilities it may have had when it was exiled. Any counters on it cease to exist; Auras attached to it are put into their owner's graveyards; and any Equipment will become unattached.

cards.originalText: Exile up to two target creatures you control, then return those cards to the battlefield under their owner's control.

cards.name: Docent of Perfection
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, create a 1/1 blue Human Wizard creature token. Then if you control three or more Wizards, transform Docent of Perfection.
cards.flavor: The time had come for him to share his findings.

rulings.text: If you control three or more Wizards while you control Docent of Perfection, it won't transform yet. It only transforms while its triggered ability is resolving after you cast an instant or sorcery spell.
Docent of Perfection's triggered ability resolves before the spell that caused it to trigger.
For more information on double-faced cards, see the Shadows over Innistrad mechanics article (http://magic.wizards.com/en/articles/archive/feature/shadows-over-innistrad-mechanics).

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, put a 1/1 blue Human Wizard creature token onto the battlefield. Then if you control three or more Wizards, transform Docent of Perfection.

cards.name: Final Iteration
cards.text:
Flying
Wizards you control get +2/+1 and have flying.
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, create a 1/1 blue Human Wizard creature token.

rulings.text: Final Iteration's triggered ability resolves before the spell that caused it to trigger.
When Docent of Perfection transforms into Final Iteration, the instant or sorcery spell that's on the stack doesn't cause Final Iteration's triggered ability to trigger.
All Wizards you control get +2/+1 and have flying, not just those created by Docent of Perfection or Final Iteration.

foreignNames.name: 繰り返しつくしたもの

cards.originalText:
Flying
Wizards you control get +2/+1 and have flying.
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, put a 1/1 blue Human Wizard creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Drag Under
cards.text:
Return target creature to its owner's hand.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Some took to their boats to escape the unfolding nightmare. The remains of their vessels now litter the shores of Nephalia.

rulings.text: If the targeted creature becomes an illegal target before Drag Under resolves, you won't draw a card.

cards.originalText:
Return target creature to its owner's hand.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Enlightened Maniac
cards.text: When Enlightened Maniac enters the battlefield, create a 3/2 colorless Eldrazi Horror creature token.
cards.flavor: "At last! Proof that it's not all in my head!"
cards.originalText: When Enlightened Maniac enters the battlefield, put a 3/2 colorless Eldrazi Horror creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Exultant Cultist
cards.text: When Exultant Cultist dies, draw a card.
cards.flavor: Amid the gibbering chorus that rose from the drownyard temple, Jace recognized a single word: "Emrakul."
cards.originalText: When Exultant Cultist dies, draw a card.

cards.name: Fogwalker
cards.text:
Skulk (This creature can't be blocked by creatures with greater power.)
When Fogwalker enters the battlefield, target creature an opponent controls doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
cards.originalText:
Skulk (This creature can't be blocked by creatures with greater power.)
When Fogwalker enters the battlefield, target creature an opponent controls doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

cards.name: Fortune's Favor
cards.text: Target opponent looks at the top four cards of your library and separates them into a face-down pile and a face-up pile. Put one pile into your hand and the other into your graveyard.
cards.flavor: Uncertainty has its own allure.

rulings.text: You choose which pile to put into your hand and which to put into your graveyard. You can't look at the face-down pile until after it's moving to its new zone.
A pile can have no cards in it. In this case, you'll choose whether to put all the cards into your hand or into your graveyard.

In a multiplayer game, the targeted opponent may choose what information to share with others if that player wants advice on how to split the cards, but that player doesn't have to share any information at all.

cards.originalText: Target opponent looks at the top four cards of your library and separates them into a face-down pile and a face-up pile. Put one pile into your hand and the other into your graveyard.

cards.name: Geist of the Archives
cards.text:
Defender
At the beginning of your upkeep, scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)
cards.flavor: After reading the final words, it turns back to the first page and begins again.
cards.originalText:
Defender
At the beginning of your upkeep, scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)

cards.name: Grizzled Angler
cards.text: {T}: Put the top two cards of your library into your graveyard. Then if there is a colorless creature card in your graveyard, transform Grizzled Angler.
cards.flavor: "There's no question that these waters are treacherous, but if there's one thing I've learned in all my years of sailing . . ."

rulings.text: If you have a colorless creature card in your graveyard while you control Grizzled Angler, it won't transform yet. It only transforms while its activated ability is resolving.
For more information on double-faced cards, see the Shadows over Innistrad mechanics article (http://magic.wizards.com/en/articles/archive/feature/shadows-over-innistrad-mechanics).

cards.originalText: {T}: Put the top two cards of your library into your graveyard. Then if there is a colorless creature card in your graveyard, transform Grizzled Angler.

cards.name: Grisly Anglerfish
cards.text: {6}: Creatures your opponents control attack this turn if able.
cards.flavor: ". . . it's that the lure of the sea is impossible to ignore."

rulings.text: If a creature affected by Grisly Anglerfish's effect hasn't been under its controller's control since the turn began, is tapped, or is affected by a spell or ability that says it can't attack, then it doesn't attack. If there's a cost associated with having that creature attack, its controller isn't forced to pay that cost, so it doesn't have to attack in that case either.

cards.originalText: {6}: Creatures your opponents control attack this turn if able.

cards.name: Identity Thief
cards.text: Whenever Identity Thief attacks, you may exile another target nontoken creature. If you do, Identity Thief becomes a copy of that creature until end of turn. Return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.

rulings.text: If the targeted creature has an ability that triggers when it attacks, it'll be too late for it to trigger once Identity Thief has that ability. The same is true if another object has an ability that triggers when a creature with certain characteristics attacks and Identity Thief doesn't have those characteristics until after it becomes a copy.

Identity Thief copies the printed values of the targeted creature, plus any copy effects that have been applied to that creature. It won't copy other effects that have changed the targeted creature's power, toughness, types, color, or so on. It also won't copy counters on the targeted creature.

If the targeted creature is a double-faced or melded permanent, Identity Thief copies the face shown. Because Identity Thief is not a double-faced card or meld card, it won't be able to transform or meld. If it copies a melded permanent or the back face of a double-faced card, its converted mana cost will be 0. Exiled double-faced cards and exiled meld cards will return with their front faces up.

If the targeted creature is itself copying a permanent, Identity Thief will become whatever it's copying, as modified by that copy effect. For example, if you target a Hamlet Captain that has become a copy of Permeating Mass, Identity Thief will become a Permeating Mass.

This effect can cause Identity Thief to stop being a creature. For example, if you target an animated Gideon Jura (a planeswalker with a loyalty ability that turns him into a creature), only the printed wording will be copied; the "becomes a creature" effect won't. Identity Thief will become a noncreature Gideon with no loyalty, be removed from combat, and then be put into its owner's graveyard.
This effect can cause Identity Thief to become a copy of a creature that can't normally attack, such as Lupine Prototype or a creature with defender. In these cases, it remains attacking.

Noncopy effects that have already applied to Identity Thief will continue to apply to it. For example, if Woodcutter's Grit gave Identity Thief +3/+3 and hexproof earlier in the turn, Identity Thief will still have those bonuses after copying a creature.

Identity Thief will still be a copy of the creature during the next end step when the exiled card returns. If it has an ability that triggers at the beginning of the end step, that ability will trigger for Identity Thief and not for the returned creature.

Auras attached to the exiled creature will be put into their owners' graveyards. Any Equipment will become unattached and remain on the battlefield. Any counters on the exiled permanent will cease to exist.

cards.originalText: Whenever Identity Thief attacks, you may exile another target nontoken creature. If you do, Identity Thief becomes a copy of that creature until end of turn. Return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.name: Imprisoned in the Moon
cards.text:
Enchant creature, land, or planeswalker
Enchanted permanent is a colorless land with "{T}: Add {C}" and loses all other card types and abilities.
cards.flavor: Only one vault was great enough to hold Emrakul.

rulings.text: At the time the permanent becomes enchanted, Imprisoned in the Moon causes it to lose all abilities except the noted mana ability. Any abilities the permanent gains after that point will work normally.
The permanent will keep any supertypes it previously had. Notably, if Imprisoned in the Moon is enchanting a legendary permanent, that permanent will continue to be legendary.

If the enchanted permanent is a land and has land types, it retains those types even though it loses any intrinsic mana abilities associated with them. For example, a Plains enchanted by Imprisoned in the Moon is still a Plains, but it can't tap for {W}, only for {C}.
If you remove Imprisoned in the Moon from a planeswalker after tapping it for mana, you can still activate a loyalty ability of that planeswalker even though it's tapped.

Becoming a land may cause other Auras to become illegally attached. These are put into their owner's graveyard, and any Equipment attached to the land become unattached and remain on the battlefield. Counters on the land remain on it even if they don't do anything.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature, land, or planeswalker
Enchanted permanent is a colorless land with "{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool" and loses all other card types and abilities.

cards.name: Ingenious Skaab
cards.text:
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
{U}: Ingenious Skaab gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Heads and shoulders above the rest.
cards.originalText:
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
{U}: Ingenious Skaab gets +1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Laboratory Brute
cards.text: When Laboratory Brute enters the battlefield, put the top four cards of your library into your graveyard.
cards.flavor: It keeps intruders out and experiments in.
cards.originalText: When Laboratory Brute enters the battlefield, put the top four cards of your library into your graveyard.

cards.name: Lunar Force
cards.text: When an opponent casts a spell, sacrifice Lunar Force and counter that spell.
cards.flavor: "Moonlight offers sublime warmth that brings me a comfort sunlight cannot provide."

rulings.text: You can't choose not to sacrifice Lunar Force.
You sacrifice Lunar Force even if the spell's already been countered, perhaps by the ability of another Lunar Force, or if the spell can't be countered.

The spell will be countered even if Lunar Force can't be sacrificed, most likely because it has already left the battlefield. Casting a spell in response to an opponent's Lunar Force's triggered ability is generally a bad idea.

cards.originalText: When an opponent casts a spell, sacrifice Lunar Force and counter that spell.

cards.name: Mausoleum Wanderer
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever another Spirit enters the battlefield under your control, Mausoleum Wanderer gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
Sacrifice Mausoleum Wanderer: Counter target instant or sorcery spell unless its controller pays {X}, where X is Mausoleum Wanderer's power.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever another Spirit enters the battlefield under your control, Mausoleum Wanderer gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
Sacrifice Mausoleum Wanderer: Counter target instant or sorcery spell unless its controller pays {X}, where X is Mausoleum Wanderer's power.

cards.name: Mind's Dilation
cards.text: Whenever an opponent casts their first spell each turn, that player exiles the top card of their library. If it's a nonland card, you may cast it without paying its mana cost.
cards.flavor: Infinite wisdom cannot be contained within a single mind.

rulings.text: If you cast the exiled card, you do so as part of the resolution of Mind's Dilation's ability. You can't wait to cast it later in the turn. Timing permissions based on the card's type are ignored, but other restrictions (such as "Cast [this card] only during combat") are not.

If you cast a card "without paying its mana cost," you can't choose to cast it for any alternative costs, such as emerge costs. You can, however, pay additional costs, such as escalate costs. If the card has any mandatory additional costs, you must pay those.
If the card has {X} in its mana cost, you must choose 0 as the value of X when casting it without paying its mana cost.
If you cast the card this way, it will resolve before the spell that caused Mind's Dilation's ability to trigger.
If you cast an instant or sorcery card this way, it goes to its owner's graveyard as normal. It doesn't return to exile.
If you don't cast the card, perhaps because you choose not to or because it's a land card, it remains exiled.

cards.originalText: Whenever an opponent casts his or her first spell each turn, that player exiles the top card of his or her library. If it's a nonland card, you may cast it without paying its mana cost.

cards.name: Nebelgast Herald
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Flying
Whenever Nebelgast Herald or another Spirit enters the battlefield under your control, tap target creature an opponent controls.

rulings.text: If Nebelgast Herald and another Spirit enter the battlefield at the same time, Nebelgast Herald's last ability triggers once for each.

cards.originalText:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Flying
Whenever Nebelgast Herald or another Spirit enters the battlefield under your control, tap target creature an opponent controls.

cards.name: Niblis of Frost
cards.text:
Flying
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, tap target creature an opponent controls. That creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

rulings.text: If multiple effects say that a creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step, those effects all apply during one untap step. For example, if you cast two instants in one turn and target the same creature twice with Niblis of Frost's ability, that creature will only spend one untap step without untapping.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, tap target creature an opponent controls. That creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

cards.name: Scour the Laboratory
cards.text:
Delirium — This spell costs {2} less to cast if there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard.
Draw three cards.
cards.flavor: "The answer's in here somewhere!"

rulings.text: If an effect allows you to cast Scour the Laboratory from your graveyard, count the number of card types among cards in your graveyard after moving Scour the Laboratory from your graveyard to the stack. If its delirium effect no longer applies, it costs {4}{U}{U} to cast.

cards.originalText:
Delirium — Scour the Laboratory costs {2} less to cast if there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard.
Draw three cards.

cards.name: Spontaneous Mutation
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -X/-0, where X is the number of cards in your graveyard.

rulings.text: The value of X will constantly update as the number of cards in your graveyard changes.

cards.originalText:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -X/-0, where X is the number of cards in your graveyard.

cards.name: Summary Dismissal
cards.text: Exile all other spells and counter all abilities.
cards.flavor: "Let's start fresh, shall we?"

rulings.text: Spells that can't be countered are exiled by Summary Dismissal. They won't resolve.

Only activated and triggered abilities on the stack are countered. Static abilities of objects remain unaffected, and activated and triggered abilities of objects may be activated or may trigger again later in the turn. Spells and abilities that have already resolved aren't affected.

cards.originalText: Exile all other spells and counter all abilities.

cards.name: Take Inventory
cards.text: Draw a card, then draw cards equal to the number of cards named Take Inventory in your graveyard.
cards.flavor: A place for everything, and everything in its place.

rulings.text: Because Take Inventory is still on the stack as it's resolving, that spell card isn't in your graveyard and won't affect the number of cards you draw.

cards.originalText: Draw a card, then draw cards equal to the number of cards named Take Inventory in your graveyard.

cards.name: Tattered Haunter
cards.text:
Flying
Tattered Haunter can block only creatures with flying.
cards.flavor: When the Nebelgast recedes, there are often stragglers.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Tattered Haunter can block only creatures with flying.

cards.name: Turn Aside
cards.text: Counter target spell that targets a permanent you control.
cards.flavor:
"There are tides beyond those in the sea that are driven by Innistrad's silver moon. If you learn their patterns, you can channel them in fascinating ways."
—Tamiyo

rulings.text: Turn Aside can target a spell that has multiple targets, as long as at least one of those targets is a permanent you control.

cards.originalText: Counter target spell that targets a permanent you control.

cards.name: Unsubstantiate
cards.text: Return target spell or creature to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"Nicely done, Jace. You always were good at disappearing acts."
—Liliana Vess

rulings.text: Spells that can't be countered can be returned to their owner's hand by Unsubstantiate. They won't resolve.
A spell that's a copy ceases to exist as a state-based action after being returned to its owner's hand. It can't be cast, and it never counts as a "card" in the player's hand.

cards.originalText: Return target spell or creature to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Wharf Infiltrator
cards.text:
Skulk (This creature can't be blocked by creatures with greater power.)
Whenever Wharf Infiltrator deals combat damage to a player, you may draw a card. If you do, discard a card.
Whenever you discard a creature card, you may pay {2}. If you do, create a 3/2 colorless Eldrazi Horror creature token.

rulings.text: Wharf Infiltrator's last ability triggers anytime you discard a creature card, not just when you discard a card because of Wharf Infiltrator's other triggered ability.
While resolving Wharf Infiltrator's last ability, you can't pay {2} multiple times to get multiple Eldrazi Horror tokens.

cards.originalText:
Skulk (This creature can't be blocked by creatures with greater power.)
Whenever Wharf Infiltrator deals combat damage to a player, you may draw a card. If you do, discard a card.
Whenever you discard a creature card, you may pay {2}. If you do, put a 3/2 colorless Eldrazi Horror creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Boon of Emrakul
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/-3.
cards.flavor: All around Emrakul, life re-formed in her image.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/-3.

cards.name: Borrowed Malevolence
cards.text:
Escalate {2} (Pay this cost for each mode chosen beyond the first.)
Choose one or both —
• Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
• Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

rulings.text: You choose all of your modes at once. You can't wait to perform one mode's actions and then decide to choose more modes.
You can't choose any one mode multiple times.

If two of the chosen modes of an escalate spell target a creature, you may choose the same creature for each mode's target, or choose different creatures. The same is true if the chosen modes target a player (or opponent).
If one target of an escalate spell becomes illegal, the other targets will still be affected. If all of the targets become illegal, the spell won't resolve.
Effects that reduce the cost of spells reduce the total cost, including any escalate costs added.
If an effect allows you to cast a spell that has escalate without paying its mana cost, you pay escalate costs for that spell if you choose more than one mode.
Additional costs don't affect a spell's converted mana cost.

cards.originalText:
Escalate {2} (Pay this cost for each mode chosen beyond the first.)
Choose one or both —
• Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
• Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Cemetery Recruitment
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand. If it's a Zombie card, draw a card.
cards.flavor: "There's a smoothness to my magic here that I don't find on any other plane."

rulings.text: If you target a Zombie card in your graveyard, drawing a card is an additional bonus. It doesn't replace returning the Zombie card to your hand.

cards.originalText: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand. If it's a Zombie card, draw a card.

cards.name: Certain Death
cards.text: Destroy target creature. Its controller loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.
cards.flavor: Some spirits cling to one person, feasting on the growing fear until a final moment of all-consuming terror.

rulings.text: The targeted creature will have already left the battlefield before its controller loses 2 life and you gain 2 life. If it has any abilities that care about gaining or losing life, they won't apply.

If the creature becomes an illegal target for Certain Death, no player gains or loses life. If it's a legal target but isn't destroyed, most likely due to having indestructible, its controller still loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.

cards.originalText: Destroy target creature. Its controller loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.

cards.name: Collective Brutality
cards.text:
Escalate—Discard a card. (Pay this cost for each mode chosen beyond the first.)
Choose one or more —
• Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose an instant or sorcery card from it. That player discards that card.
• Target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.
• Target opponent loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.

rulings.text: You choose all of your modes at once. You can't wait to perform one mode's actions and then decide to choose more modes.
You can't choose any one mode multiple times.

If two of the chosen modes of an escalate spell target a creature, you may choose the same creature for each mode's target, or choose different creatures. The same is true if the chosen modes target a player (or opponent).
If one target of an escalate spell becomes illegal, the other targets will still be affected. If all of the targets become illegal, the spell won't resolve.
Effects that reduce the cost of spells reduce the total cost, including any escalate costs added.
If an effect allows you to cast a spell that has escalate without paying its mana cost, you pay escalate costs for that spell if you choose more than one mode.
Additional costs don't affect a spell's converted mana cost.

cards.originalText:
Escalate—Discard a card. (Pay this cost for each mode chosen beyond the first.)
Choose one or more —
• Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose an instant or sorcery card from it. That player discards that card.
• Target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.
• Target opponent loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.

cards.name: Cryptbreaker
cards.text:
{1}{B}, {T}, Discard a card: Create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.
Tap three untapped Zombies you control: You draw a card and you lose 1 life.

rulings.text: You can tap any three untapped Zombies you control, including ones you haven't controlled continuously since the beginning of your most recent turn, to pay the cost of Cryptbreaker's second activated ability. This includes Cryptbreaker itself.

cards.originalText:
{1}{B}, {T}, Discard a card: Put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield.
Tap three untapped Zombies you control: You draw a card and you lose 1 life.

cards.name: Dark Salvation
cards.text: Target player creates X 2/2 black Zombie creature tokens, then up to one target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn for each Zombie that player controls.
cards.flavor: Countless ghouls surged through Thraben's streets, and with them came the city's salvation.

rulings.text: You choose up to one target creature total, not a separate target for each Zombie that player controls.
If the targeted creature becomes an illegal target, the targeted player will still get Zombie tokens.

You may cast Dark Salvation with X as 0 just to have a creature get -1/-1 for each Zombie a player controls, and you may cast it without targeting any creature just to have a player get Zombie tokens. If you really just want to cast a spell, you can even cast it with X as 0 without a target creature and have neither effect do anything.

cards.originalText: Target player puts X 2/2 black Zombie creature tokens onto the battlefield, then up to one target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn for each Zombie that player controls.

cards.name: Dusk Feaster
cards.text:
Delirium — This spell costs {2} less to cast if there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard.
Flying
cards.flavor: The Voldaren lands remained well protected when Olivia's army marched from Lurenbraum Fortress.
cards.originalText:
Delirium — Dusk Feaster costs {2} less to cast if there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard.
Flying

cards.name: Gavony Unhallowed
cards.text: Whenever another creature you control dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Gavony Unhallowed.
cards.flavor:
"We entered the church in search of solace, but it became clear we wouldn't find it there."
—Grete, Order of Saint Traft

rulings.text: If Gavony Unhallowed and another creature you control die simultaneously (perhaps because they were both attacking or blocking), Gavony Unhallowed won't be on the battlefield as its triggered ability resolves. It can't be saved by the +1/+1 counter that would have been put on it.

foreignNames.name: ガヴォニーの不浄なるもの

cards.originalText: Whenever another creature you control dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Gavony Unhallowed.

cards.name: Graf Harvest
cards.text:
Zombies you control have menace. (They can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
{3}{B}, Exile a creature card from your graveyard: Create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.
cards.originalText:
Zombies you control have menace. (They can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
{3}{B}, Exile a creature card from your graveyard: Put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Graf Rats
cards.text: At the beginning of combat on your turn, if you both own and control Graf Rats and a creature named Midnight Scavengers, exile them, then meld them into Chittering Host.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of combat on your turn, if you both own and control Graf Rats and a creature named Midnight Scavengers, exile them, then meld them into Chittering Host.

cards.name: Chittering Host
cards.text:
Haste
Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
When Chittering Host enters the battlefield, other creatures you control get +1/+0 and gain menace until end of turn.

rulings.text: The set of creatures affected by Chittering Host's triggered ability is determined as the ability resolves. Creatures you begin to control later in the turn won't get +1/+0 or gain menace.
For more information on meld cards, see the Eldritch Moon mechanics article (http://magic.wizards.com/en/articles/archive/feature/eldritch-moon-mechanics).

cards.originalText:
Haste
Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
When Chittering Host enters the battlefield, other creatures you control get +1/+0 and gain menace until end of turn.

cards.name: Haunted Dead
cards.text:
When Haunted Dead enters the battlefield, create a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying.
{1}{B}, Discard two cards: Return Haunted Dead from your graveyard to the battlefield tapped.

rulings.text: Haunted Dead's last ability can only be activated while it's in your graveyard.

cards.originalText:
When Haunted Dead enters the battlefield, put a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
{1}{B}, Discard two cards: Return Haunted Dead from your graveyard to the battlefield tapped.

cards.name: Liliana, the Last Hope
cards.text:
+1: Up to one target creature gets -2/-1 until your next turn.
−2: Put the top two cards of your library into your graveyard, then you may return a creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
−7: You get an emblem with "At the beginning of your end step, create X 2/2 black Zombie creature tokens, where X is two plus the number of Zombies you control."

rulings.text: You can activate Liliana's first ability without any targets just to add a loyalty counter to her.
Liliana's second ability doesn't target the card to return to your hand. After putting the top two cards of your library into your graveyard, you may choose from among any creature cards there.
While resolving the triggered ability of Liliana's emblem, if you control zero Zombies, you'll get two Zombie tokens.

cards.originalText:
+1: Up to one target creature gets -2/-1 until your next turn.
−2: Put the top two cards of your library into your graveyard, then you may return a creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
−7: You get an emblem with "At the beginning of your end step, put X 2/2 black Zombie creature tokens onto the battlefield, where X is two plus the number of Zombies you control."

cards.name: Liliana's Elite
cards.text: Liliana's Elite gets +1/+1 for each creature card in your graveyard.
cards.flavor:
"You have to admit, Gideon—he has great form."
—Liliana Vess

rulings.text: The ability applies only while Liliana's Elite is on the battlefield.

cards.originalText: Liliana's Elite gets +1/+1 for each creature card in your graveyard.

cards.name: Markov Crusader
cards.text:
Lifelink
Markov Crusader has haste as long as you control another Vampire.
cards.flavor: The surviving members of the Markov bloodline drove through a crush of horrors to reclaim their ancestral home.

rulings.text: If Markov Crusader loses haste before the declare attackers step on the turn it enters the battlefield, it won't be able to attack. Once you've attacked with Markov Crusader, causing it to lose haste won't remove it from combat.

cards.originalText:
Lifelink
Markov Crusader has haste as long as you control another Vampire.

cards.name: Midnight Scavengers
cards.text:
When Midnight Scavengers enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card with converted mana cost 3 or less from your graveyard to your hand.
(Melds with Graf Rats.)

rulings.text: If a card in a player's graveyard has {X} in its mana cost, X is considered to be 0.

cards.originalText:
When Midnight Scavengers enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card with converted mana cost 3 or less from your graveyard to your hand.
(Melds with Graf Rats.)

cards.name: Murder
cards.text: Destroy target creature.
cards.flavor: "It's not work if you enjoy it."
cards.originalText: Destroy target creature.

cards.name: Noosegraf Mob
cards.text:
Noosegraf Mob enters the battlefield with five +1/+1 counters on it.
Whenever a player casts a spell, remove a +1/+1 counter from Noosegraf Mob. If you do, create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.

rulings.text: If Noosegraf Mob is no longer on the battlefield or no longer has +1/+1 counters on it as its triggered ability resolves, you can't remove a counter from it and won't get a Zombie token.
You can't remove more than one +1/+1 counter from Noosegraf Mob at once to get more Zombie tokens, and you can't choose not to remove a counter.
Noosegraf Mob's triggered ability resolves before the spell that caused it to trigger.

cards.originalText:
Noosegraf Mob enters the battlefield with five +1/+1 counters on it.
Whenever a player casts a spell, remove a +1/+1 counter from Noosegraf Mob. If you do, put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Oath of Liliana
cards.text:
When Oath of Liliana enters the battlefield, each opponent sacrifices a creature.
At the beginning of each end step, if a planeswalker entered the battlefield under your control this turn, create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.
cards.flavor: "I'll keep watch. Happy now?"

rulings.text: Oath of Liliana's last ability will trigger even if the planeswalker that entered the battlefield under your control is no longer on the battlefield, no longer under your control, or no longer a planeswalker. This is also true if Oath of Liliana wasn't on the battlefield when the planeswalker entered.
The last ability triggers only once per turn, even if more than one planeswalker entered the battlefield under your control.

Oath of Liliana is legendary, just like the previous Oaths from Oath of the Gatewatch. If you already control an Oath of Liliana, you can still cast a second Oath of Liliana to take advantage of its enters-the-battlefield ability. It will enter the battlefield, causing its first ability to trigger. You will then choose one to keep, and the other will be put into your graveyard.

cards.originalText:
When Oath of Liliana enters the battlefield, each opponent sacrifices a creature.
At the beginning of each end step, if a planeswalker entered the battlefield under your control this turn, put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Olivia's Dragoon
cards.text: Discard a card: Olivia's Dragoon gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Displays of Voldaren bloodlust are not restricted to glamorous banquets and lavish parties.

rulings.text: You can activate the ability more than once in a turn, even if Olivia's Dragoon already has flying.

cards.originalText: Discard a card: Olivia's Dragoon gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Prying Questions
cards.text: Target opponent loses 3 life and puts a card from their hand on top of their library.
cards.flavor: What remained of the Lunarch Inquisition found new ways to extract confessions.

rulings.text: Prying Questions can target an opponent who has no cards in hand. That player just loses 3 life.

cards.originalText: Target opponent loses 3 life and puts a card from his or her hand on top of his or her library.

cards.name: Rise from the Grave
cards.text: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. That creature is a black Zombie in addition to its other colors and types.
cards.flavor:
"Don't get too comfortable in there."
—Liliana Vess

rulings.text: Rise from the Grave doesn't overwrite any previous colors or types. Rather, it adds another color and another subtype.
If the creature is normally colorless, it will simply become black. It can't be both black and colorless.

A later effect that changes the affected creature's colors will overwrite that part of Rise from the Grave's effect; the creature will be only the new color. The same is true about an effect that changes the affected creature's types or subtypes.

cards.originalText: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. That creature is a black Zombie in addition to its other colors and types.

cards.name: Ruthless Disposal
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, discard a card and sacrifice a creature.
Two target creatures each get -13/-13 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Do try to pull your weight, Geralf. I feel like I'm doing everything."
—Ghoulcaller Gisa

rulings.text: Discarding a card and sacrificing a creature are both part of Ruthless Disposal's cost. You can't discard or sacrifice more to target more creatures, and you can't cast Ruthless Disposal at all if you don't have any other cards in hand or if you control no creatures.
There's no way to discard a creature card with madness, cast it, and sacrifice it to pay for both of Ruthless Disposal's additional costs.
Once you begin to cast Ruthless Disposal, no player may take actions until you're done. Notably, opponents can't try to remove the creature you wish to sacrifice.
You must target exactly two creatures to cast Ruthless Disposal. However, one of the targets can be the creature you intend to sacrifice to pay Ruthless Disposal's cost.
If one targeted creature becomes an illegal target, the other will still get -13/-13 until end of turn.
You can't target one creature twice to give it -26/-26.

cards.originalText:
As an additional cost to cast Ruthless Disposal, discard a card and sacrifice a creature.
Two target creatures each get -13/-13 until end of turn.

cards.name: Skirsdag Supplicant
cards.text: {B}, {T}, Discard a card: Each player loses 2 life.
cards.flavor:
"I can no longer stand by as these Skirsdag infiltrators rot the church from within. Even the Lunarch Council is compromised. What a fool I've been."
—Odric

rulings.text: If Skirsdag Supplicant's ability causes each player's life total to become 0 or less, the game ends in a draw.
In a Two-Headed Giant game, Skirsdag Supplicant's ability causes each player to lose 2 life, so each team loses a total of 4 life.

foreignNames.name: スカースダグの嘆願者

cards.originalText: {B}, {T}, Discard a card: Each player loses 2 life.

cards.name: Strange Augmentation
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.
Delirium — Enchanted creature gets an additional +2/+2 as long as there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.
Delirium — Enchanted creature gets an additional +2/+2 as long as there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard.

cards.name: Stromkirk Condemned
cards.text: Discard a card: Vampires you control get +1/+1 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
cards.flavor:
"Blood from the vein is the finest vintage to accompany a feast of the mind."
—Runo Stromkirk

rulings.text: If you discard a Vampire card with madness and cast it, it'll enter the battlefield before Stromkirk Condemned's ability resolves.
The set of creatures affected by Stromkirk Condemned's ability is determined as the ability resolves. Vampires you begin to control later in the turn won't get +1/+1.

cards.originalText: Discard a card: Vampires you control get +1/+1 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.

cards.name: Succumb to Temptation
cards.text: You draw two cards and you lose 2 life.
cards.flavor: "Restraint is for the meek."
cards.originalText: You draw two cards and you lose 2 life.

cards.name: Thraben Foulbloods
cards.text: Delirium — Thraben Foulbloods gets +1/+1 and has menace as long as there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard. (A creature with menace can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
cards.flavor: The famed hunting hounds of House Cecani continue to prove the quality of their pedigree.

rulings.text: Menace only matters as blockers are chosen. Causing Thraben Foulbloods to gain menace after blockers are chosen won't cause it to become unblocked.

cards.originalText: Delirium — Thraben Foulbloods gets +1/+1 and has menace as long as there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard. (A creature with menace can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)

cards.name: Tree of Perdition
cards.text:
Defender
{T}: Exchange target opponent's life total with Tree of Perdition's toughness.
cards.flavor: There will be no absolution.

rulings.text: If Tree of Perdition isn't on the battlefield when the ability resolves, the exchange can't happen and the ability will have no effect. Notably, activating the ability and giving Tree of Perdition -13/-13 in response won't cause your opponent to lose the game.

When the ability resolves, Tree of Perdition's toughness becomes the targeted opponent's former life total and that player gains or loses an amount of life necessary so that their life total equals Tree of Perdition's former toughness. Other effects that interact with life gain or life loss will interact with this effect accordingly.

Any toughness-modifying effects, counters, Auras, or Equipment will apply after its toughness is set to the player's former life total. For example, say Tree of Perdition is equipped with Cultist's Staff (which makes it 2/15) and the player's life total is 7. After the exchange, Tree of Perdition would be a 2/9 creature (its toughness became 7, which was then modified by Cultist's Staff) and the player's life total would be 15.

cards.originalText:
Defender
{T}: Exchange target opponent's life total with Tree of Perdition's toughness.

cards.name: Vampire Cutthroat
cards.text:
Skulk (This creature can't be blocked by creatures with greater power.)
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
cards.flavor: Not all monsters have tentacles.
cards.originalText:
Skulk (This creature can't be blocked by creatures with greater power.)
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)

cards.name: Voldaren Pariah
cards.text:
Flying
Sacrifice three other creatures: Transform Voldaren Pariah.
Madness {B}{B}{B} (If you discard this card, discard it into exile. When you do, cast it for its madness cost or put it into your graveyard.)

rulings.text: For more information on double-faced cards, see the Shadows over Innistrad mechanics article (http://magic.wizards.com/en/articles/archive/feature/shadows-over-innistrad-mechanics).

foreignNames.name: ヴォルダーレンの下層民

cards.originalText:
Flying
Sacrifice three other creatures: Transform Voldaren Pariah.
Madness {B}{B}{B} (If you discard this card, discard it into exile. When you do, cast it for its madness cost or put it into your graveyard.)

cards.name: Abolisher of Bloodlines
cards.text:
Flying
When this creature transforms into Abolisher of Bloodlines, target opponent sacrifices three creatures.
cards.flavor: Even if the rain turned to blood, her thirst would not be slaked.

rulings.text: If the targeted opponent doesn't control three creatures as the triggered ability of Abolisher of Bloodlines resolves, that player sacrifices as many creatures as able.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When this creature transforms into Abolisher of Bloodlines, target opponent sacrifices three creatures.

cards.name: Wailing Ghoul
cards.text: When Wailing Ghoul enters the battlefield, put the top two cards of your library into your graveyard.
cards.flavor:
"Don't worry, sweet brother. Help is on the way."
—Ghoulcaller Gisa
cards.originalText: When Wailing Ghoul enters the battlefield, put the top two cards of your library into your graveyard.

cards.text: Madness {2}{B} (If you discard this card, discard it into exile. When you do, cast it for its madness cost or put it into your graveyard.)
cards.flavor:
"Emrakul makes apparent those whom she has favored."
—Runo Stromkirk
cards.originalText: Madness {2}{B} (If you discard this card, discard it into exile. When you do, cast it for its madness cost or put it into your graveyard.)

cards.name: Whispers of Emrakul
cards.text:
Target opponent discards a card at random.
Delirium — If there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard, that player discards two cards at random instead.
cards.flavor: Your thoughts are no longer your own.
cards.originalText:
Target opponent discards a card at random.
Delirium — If there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard, that player discards two cards at random instead.

cards.name: Abandon Reason
cards.text:
Up to two target creatures each get +1/+0 and gain first strike until end of turn.
Madness {1}{R} (If you discard this card, discard it into exile. When you do, cast it for its madness cost or put it into your graveyard.)

rulings.text: You can't target the same creature twice to have it get +2/+0.

Up to two target creatures each get +1/+0 and gain first strike until end of turn.
Madness {1}{R} (If you discard this card, discard it into exile. When you do, cast it for its madness cost or put it into your graveyard.)

cards.name: Alchemist's Greeting
cards.text:
Alchemist's Greeting deals 4 damage to target creature.
Madness {1}{R} (If you discard this card, discard it into exile. When you do, cast it for its madness cost or put it into your graveyard.)
cards.flavor:
"Impressive."
—Chandra Nalaar
cards.originalText:
Alchemist's Greeting deals 4 damage to target creature.
Madness {1}{R} (If you discard this card, discard it into exile. When you do, cast it for its madness cost or put it into your graveyard.)

cards.name: Assembled Alphas
cards.text: Whenever Assembled Alphas blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, Assembled Alphas deals 3 damage to that creature and 3 damage to that creature's controller.
cards.flavor: There is always a toll to pay for passage.

rulings.text: The triggered ability triggers once for each creature blocking or blocked by Assembled Alphas. The ability resolves and deals damage to that creature before combat damage is dealt. If that damage destroys all creatures blocking Assembled Alphas, Assembled Alphas doesn't become unblocked.
The triggered ability deals damage to the creature's controller even if the creature isn't dealt damage, perhaps because it has left the battlefield or because the damage was prevented.

cards.originalText: Whenever Assembled Alphas blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, Assembled Alphas deals 3 damage to that creature and 3 damage to that creature's controller.

cards.name: Bedlam Reveler
cards.text:
This spell costs {1} less to cast for each instant and sorcery card in your graveyard.
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
When Bedlam Reveler enters the battlefield, discard your hand, then draw three cards.

rulings.text: Bedlam Reveler's first ability can reduce only the generic mana in its cost, not the red mana.
If you have no cards in hand as Bedlam Reveler's last ability resolves, you'll just draw three cards.

cards.originalText:
Bedlam Reveler costs {1} less to cast for each instant and sorcery card in your graveyard.
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
When Bedlam Reveler enters the battlefield, discard your hand, then draw three cards.

cards.name: Blood Mist
cards.text: At the beginning of combat on your turn, target creature you control gains double strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Some claim that rage is a cloud that obscures thought and vision. But I can assure you—I've never seen with greater clarity."
cards.originalText: At the beginning of combat on your turn, target creature you control gains double strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Bold Impaler
cards.text: {2}{R}: Bold Impaler gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Burning with hatred for Nahiri, the Voldaren and Markov forces assaulted the warped Markov Manor with a collective fury not seen in centuries.
cards.originalText: {2}{R}: Bold Impaler gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Borrowed Hostility
cards.text:
Escalate {3} (Pay this cost for each mode chosen beyond the first.)
Choose one or both —
• Target creature gets +3/+0 until end of turn.
• Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.

rulings.text: You choose all of your modes at once. You can't wait to perform one mode's actions and then decide to choose more modes.
You can't choose any one mode multiple times.

If two of the chosen modes of an escalate spell target a creature, you may choose the same creature for each mode's target, or choose different creatures. The same is true if the chosen modes target a player (or opponent).
If one target of an escalate spell becomes illegal, the other targets will still be affected. If all of the targets become illegal, the spell won't resolve.
Effects that reduce the cost of spells reduce the total cost, including any escalate costs added.
If an effect allows you to cast a spell that has escalate without paying its mana cost, you pay escalate costs for that spell if you choose more than one mode.
Additional costs don't affect a spell's converted mana cost.

cards.originalText:
Escalate {3} (Pay this cost for each mode chosen beyond the first.)
Choose one or both —
• Target creature gets +3/+0 until end of turn.
• Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Brazen Wolves
cards.text: Whenever Brazen Wolves attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: With fewer patrols about, Kessig's roads have become prime hunting grounds.
cards.originalText: Whenever Brazen Wolves attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Collective Defiance
cards.text:
Escalate {1} (Pay this cost for each mode chosen beyond the first.)
Choose one or more —
• Target player discards all the cards in their hand, then draws that many cards.
• Collective Defiance deals 4 damage to target creature.
• Collective Defiance deals 3 damage to target opponent or planeswalker.

rulings.text: You choose all of your modes at once. You can't wait to perform one mode's actions and then decide to choose more modes.
You can't choose any one mode multiple times.

If two of the chosen modes of an escalate spell target a creature, you may choose the same creature for each mode's target, or choose different creatures. The same is true if the chosen modes target a player (or opponent).
If one target of an escalate spell becomes illegal, the other targets will still be affected. If all of the targets become illegal, the spell won't resolve.
Effects that reduce the cost of spells reduce the total cost, including any escalate costs added.
If an effect allows you to cast a spell that has escalate without paying its mana cost, you pay escalate costs for that spell if you choose more than one mode.
Additional costs don't affect a spell's converted mana cost.

cards.originalText:
Escalate {1} (Pay this cost for each mode chosen beyond the first.)
Choose one or more —
• Target player discards all the cards in his or her hand, then draws that many cards.
• Collective Defiance deals 4 damage to target creature.
• Collective Defiance deals 3 damage to target opponent.

cards.name: Conduit of Storms
cards.text:
Whenever Conduit of Storms attacks, add {R} at the beginning of your next main phase this turn.
{3}{R}{R}: Transform Conduit of Storms.
cards.flavor: It strikes with the fury of a tempest.

rulings.text: You'll add mana to your mana pool at the beginning of the next main phase whether or not Conduit of Storms is still on the battlefield.
If Conduit of Storms attacks and you transform it into Conduit of Emrakul later in combat, you'll add {R} to your mana pool, not {C}{C} and not {C}{C}{R}.
For more information on double-faced cards, see the Shadows over Innistrad mechanics article (http://magic.wizards.com/en/articles/archive/feature/shadows-over-innistrad-mechanics).

cards.name: Furyblade Vampire
cards.text:
Trample
At the beginning of combat on your turn, you may discard a card. If you do, Furyblade Vampire gets +3/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Writhe all you want, filth. It will do you no good."

rulings.text: While resolving Furyblade Vampire's triggered ability, you can't discard multiple cards to multiply the bonus.

cards.originalText:
Trample
At the beginning of combat on your turn, you may discard a card. If you do, Furyblade Vampire gets +3/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Galvanic Bombardment
cards.text: Galvanic Bombardment deals X damage to target creature, where X is 2 plus the number of cards named Galvanic Bombardment in your graveyard.
cards.flavor: Geist-powered devices have no shortage of fuel.

rulings.text: Because Galvanic Bombardment is still on the stack as you determine the value of X, it is not in your graveyard and will not add to the value of X.

cards.originalText: Galvanic Bombardment deals X damage to target creature, where X is 2 plus the number of cards named Galvanic Bombardment in your graveyard.

cards.name: Hanweir Garrison
cards.text:
Whenever Hanweir Garrison attacks, create two 1/1 red Human creature tokens that are tapped and attacking.
(Melds with Hanweir Battlements.)
cards.flavor: "We're ready for anything!"

rulings.text: You choose which opponent or planeswalker controlled by an opponent each token is attacking as it enters the battlefield. It doesn't have to be the same opponent or planeswalker that the trigger's source is attacking, and the tokens don't both have to attack the same player or planeswalker.

On the turn they enter the battlefield, the tokens are never declared as attacking creatures. They simply enter the battlefield attacking. They won't cause any abilities that trigger "whenever a creature attacks" to trigger.

If another ability of a source you control triggers when attackers are declared, such as that of Hamlet Captain, you may have it resolve before or after that of Hanweir Garrison. If that ability has targets, it won't be able to target the tokens.

cards.originalText:
Whenever Hanweir Garrison attacks, put two 1/1 red Human creature tokens onto the battlefield tapped and attacking.
(Melds with Hanweir Battlements.)

cards.name: Hanweir, the Writhing Township
cards.text:
Trample, haste
Whenever Hanweir, the Writhing Township attacks, create two 3/2 colorless Eldrazi Horror creature tokens that are tapped and attacking.

rulings.text: You choose which opponent or planeswalker controlled by an opponent each token is attacking as it enters the battlefield. It doesn't have to be the same opponent or planeswalker that the trigger's source is attacking, and the tokens don't both have to attack the same player or planeswalker.

On the turn they enter the battlefield, the tokens are never declared as attacking creatures. They simply enter the battlefield attacking. They won't cause any abilities that trigger "whenever a creature attacks" to trigger.

If another ability of a source you control triggers when attackers are declared, such as that of Hamlet Captain, you may have it resolve before or after that of Hanweir, the Writhing Township. If that ability has targets, it won't be able to target the tokens.
For more information on meld cards, see the Eldritch Moon mechanics article (http://magic.wizards.com/en/articles/archive/feature/eldritch-moon-mechanics).

cards.name: Harmless Offering
cards.text: Target opponent gains control of target permanent you control.
cards.flavor: "Such an adorable face!"

rulings.text: Your opponent can't refuse your generous donation.

cards.originalText: Target opponent gains control of target permanent you control.

cards.name: Impetuous Devils
cards.text:
Trample, haste
When Impetuous Devils attacks, up to one target creature defending player controls blocks it this combat if able.
At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice Impetuous Devils.

rulings.text: If a creature affected by the first triggered ability of Impetuous Devils is tapped or is affected by a spell or ability that says it can't block, then it doesn't block. If there's a cost associated with having that creature block, its controller isn't forced to pay that cost, so it doesn't have to block in that case either.

cards.originalText:
Trample, haste
When Impetuous Devils attacks, up to one target creature defending player controls blocks it this combat if able.
At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice Impetuous Devils.

cards.name: Incendiary Flow
cards.text: Incendiary Flow deals 3 damage to any target. If a creature dealt damage this way would die this turn, exile it instead.
cards.flavor:
"What's your plan?" Gideon asked.
"Are you serious?" Chandra replied.

rulings.text: The damaged creature will be exiled if it would die for any reason that turn, not just if it dies due to damage from Incendiary Flow.

cards.originalText: Incendiary Flow deals 3 damage to target creature or player. If a creature dealt damage this way would die this turn, exile it instead.
